intro: Oedera flavicoma, commonly known as the yellow-haired oedera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellowish stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Oedera flavicoma is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
